creator: issues.apache.org@chasmcity.com
text:
There would appear to be no way to add comments to files that are included by
PatternSet includesfile and excludes file.

It would be great to be able to add comments to these files, perhaps using the #
character.

creator: mbenson@apache.org
text: I was just thinking this yesterday actually.  Let me do some research.

Does anyone have any knowledge of a character that is completely invalid in a
filename for all platforms?  Just UNIX and Windows, even, for a start?  Most
characters seem usable on UNIX platforms when escaped, so I can't locate a
character that would be a suitable comment indicator for includes/excludes files.
creator: mbenson@apache.org

text:
I don't think there is one.

Here's a suggestion - add an optional attribute to <includesfile> and
<excludesfile> which instructs the task/type to look for comments in the file. 
Then you could use something obvious like the # character, but you have to
explictly enable their use in the Ant script.  The defautt would be to treat
every line as a file pattern.
